discover.title: üå† Discover Cipher Pulse
discover.subtitle: Dive into the technology that protects your conversations
discover.overview_description_1: Cipher Pulse is an ultra-secure messenger combining
discover.dicekey_desc: Instead of a classic password, use
discover.why_strong_1: 775 bits of entropy (vs 128 bits for a strong password)
discover.why_strong_2: Impossible to guess by brute force
discover.e2e_desc: Your messages are encrypted on your device and can only be decrypted by the recipient.
discover.signal_desc: The same protocol used by Signal, WhatsApp and other secure messengers.
discover.signal_desc_full: End-to-end encryption with Perfect Forward Secrecy and Post-Compromise Security.
discover.one_time_prekeys: One-Time Pre-Keys: Each message uses a unique key
discover.signatures_desc: Ed25519 for authentication and integrity verification
discover.burn_desc: Messages can self-destruct after reading, ensuring they don't remain on the recipient's device.
discover.burn_desc_full: Self-destructing messages after reading. The server keeps no copy after destruction.
discover.burn_mode_after_reading_desc: Destruction starts when the recipient opens the message
discover.audit_trail: Audit trail: Destruction logged in audit_logs
discover.burn_step_2: Message is marked as 'burn' in the database
discover.burn_step_4: Message is deleted from local database and UI
discover.timelock_desc: Lock a message until a specific date/time. The message can only be decrypted after that date.
discover.timelock_desc_full: Messages locked until a block height is reached on the blockchain.
discover.timelock_step_1_full: Sender defines a target block height (e.g., 850000)
discover.timelock_step_4_full: Automatic unlock when block is reached
discover.impossible_to_cheat: Impossible to cheat: The blockchain is immutable
discover.timelock_step_2: Message is encrypted with a temporary key
discover.timelock_step_3: Key is locked on the Bitcoin blockchain
discover.timelock_step_4: After the date, the key is unlocked and the message can be read
discover.zero_knowledge_desc: The server can never read your messages. Only you and your contacts have the keys.
discover.no_metadata_desc: We don't collect metadata about your conversations.
discover.open_source_desc: The code is open and auditable by everyone.
discover.post_quantum_desc: Architecture designed to resist future quantum computers.
discover.vite_section_desc: Cipher Pulse uses Vite + React as an SPA (Single Page Application). This architectural choice avoids a large class of SSR-related vulnerabilities.
discover.vite_auth_note: Authentication is handled via JWT + SRP (Zero-Knowledge) through our Fastify API, never by the frontend.

recovery.title: Account Recovery
recovery.mark_key_lost: Mark my primary key as LOST
recovery.reason_missing_key: We couldn't find the local encryption key for this account on this device.
recovery.reason_default: We cannot use your usual keys on this device.
recovery.analyze_options: We will analyze your recovery options using your Trust Star.
recovery.mark_lost_desc_1: Use this option only if you have permanently lost access to your encryption key (e.g., DiceKey destroyed, mnemonic phrase lost, no backup available).
recovery.mark_lost_desc_2: After this action, your Trust Star will clearly show that your old encrypted messages are considered irreversibly lost. You can still recreate an identity, but not recover past content.
recovery.confirm_mark_lost:
‚ö†Ô∏è IRREVERSIBLE ACTION

Marking your key as LOST means your old encrypted messages will be considered permanently unrecoverable, even if you later find a backup.

This action does not affect your contacts or identity, but it forces the system to treat this key as destroyed.

Confirm only if you are absolutely certain you have lost your keys.
recovery.mark_success: Your primary key is now marked as LOST. The Trust Star reflects this situation and indicates that old messages are irreversible.
recovery.restore_desc: If you have already created an encrypted backup of your local database, you can restore it from the "Backup & Export" screen. The Trust Star will update your status after restoration.
